channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Delta CEO predicts Americans will soon be ready to travel to Riyadh as he launches first-ever direct flights from the U.S. to Saudi Arabia
item.description: Acknowledging that "Americans aren't quite sure" about visiting, Delta CEO Ed Bastian told Fortune that the route will be popular—eventually.

item.title: As This President Tours Asia, Democracy’s Ideals Aren’t on the Agenda
item.description: Several of the leaders President Trump will encounter are either autocrats or presiding over fragile democracies. And some admire his willingness to b...

item.title: A decade into Saudi Arabia’s Vision 2030, the non-oil sector makes up 56% of $1.3 trillion economy
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Why is Washington acting like the U.S. is in a recession?
item.description: On paper, the economy is growing and unemployment is low. But federal government policymakers are behaving like there is an imminent crisis.

item.title: A New Dynamic in the Trump-Netanyahu Relationship
item.description: Since an Israel-Hamas cease-fire deal came into effect, the U.S. effort to sustain it appears to have constrained Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Strains in Short-Term Markets Raise Urgency of Fed Balance Sheet Debate
item.description: Warning signs in crucial money markets have raised the prospect that the central bank will soon stop reducing its portfolio of government debt and mor...

item.title: Brazil’s Lula confident of U.S. trade deal after Trump talks: ‘Heguaranteed to me that we will reach an agreement’
item.description: The 79-year-old Trump wished the 80-year-old Lula a Happy Birthday from aboard Air Force One, saying he was "very impressed" by the "vigorous guy"

item.title: Will Trump’s Tariffs Survive Supreme Court’s ‘Major Questions’ Test?
item.description: The justices used the doctrine, a judicially created method of reading statutes, to thwart several major Biden programs.

item.title: Trump hails Milei’s Argentina win, says U.S. made ‘lot of money’
item.description: As recently as last Tuesday, Argentina’s peso had slumped to a record low, and its bonds were selling off as traders prepared for the weekend election...

item.title: Saudi Arabia, Rich With Oil, Wants to Be Known as the A.I. Exporter
item.description: The kingdom is pouring money into data centers and working with U.S. and Chinese tech giants, landing its A.I. ambitions in the middle of a geopolitic...

item.title: 3 Takeaways From Vietnam’s Drift Toward Russia and Away From America
item.description: The Times examined weapons sales documents from a Russian arms supplier and interviewed dozens of officials from Vietnam, the United States and other ...

item.title: Is the U.S. Losing in Vietnam? Russia, North Korea and China Are Gaining.
item.description: U.S. allies worry that American volatility and Russian outreach and arms sales, in particular, are driving Vietnam into a new phase.

item.title: A New Dynamic in the Trump-Netanyahu Relationship
item.description: Since an Israel-Hamas cease-fire deal came into effect, the U.S. effort to sustain it appears to have constrained Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Why Trump’s Asia Visit Is Consequential
item.description: President Trump has embarked on a six-day diplomatic tour of Asia, testing his role as a statesman and negotiator as he pursues a trade deal with Chin...
